item.title: Tracy add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "It was easy enough to despise the world, but decidedly difficult to find any other habitable region." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Kristin Kimball
item.description: "There is no such thing as escape after all, only an exchange of one set of difficulties for another. It wasn't Mark or the farm or marriage I was trying to shake loose from but my own imperfect self, and even if I kept moving, she would dog me all the way around the world, forever." -- Kristin Kimball

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Those are my principles, and if you don't like them...well I have others." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tracy add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Red hair, sir, in my opinion, is dangerous." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tracy add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Unseen in the background, Fate was quietly slipping lead into the boxing-glove." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The friend who holds your hand and says the wrong thing is made of dearer stuff than the one who stays away." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Tracy add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I always advise people never to give advice." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Everybody does have a book in them, but in most cases that's where it should stay." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "Children are a burden to a mother, but not the way a heavy box is to a mule. Our children weight hard on my heart, and thinking about them growing up honest and healthy, or just living to grow up at all, makes a load in my chest that is bigger than the safe at the bank,and more valuable to me than all the gold inside it." -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "Some people sense is wasted on and that's purely a fact." -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "It is a good idea sometimes to think of the importance and dignity of our every-day duties. It keeps them from being so tiresome; besides, others are apt take us at our own valuation. " -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Tracy add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "I merely say that all reading for pleasure is escape, whether it be Greek, mathematics, astronomy, Benedetto Croce, or The Diary of the Forgotten Man. To say otherwise is to be an intellectual snob, and a juvenile at the art of living." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Rob Bell
item.description: "Why blame the dark for being dark? It is far more helpful to ask why the light isn’t as bright as it could be." -- Rob Bell

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "I'll not listen to reason... reason always means what someone else has got to say." -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description:
"I'm nobody! Who are you? Are you nobody, too? Then there ’s a pair of us—don’t tell! They ’d banish us, you know.
How dreary to be somebody! How public, like a frog To tell your name the livelong day To an admiring bog!" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I don't profess to be profound; but I do lay claim to common sense." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee and just as hard to sleep after." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "From 30 feet away she looked like a lot of class. From 10 feet away she looked like something made up to be seen from 30 feet away." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "I do not believe that sheer suffering teaches. If suffering alone taught, all the world would be wise, since everyone suffers. To suffering must be added mourning, understanding, patience, love, openness, and the willingness to remain vulnerable." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Tracy add a quote by A.A. Milne
Tracy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tracy add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "He had the look of one who had drunk the cup of life and found a dead beetle at the bottom." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The only reason why we ask other people how their weekend was is so we can tell them about our own weekend." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "There is no trap so deadly as the trap you set for yourself." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Dorothy Dunnett
item.description: "I would give you my soul in a blackberry pie; and a knife to cut it with." -- Dorothy Dunnett

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Katharine Weber
item.description: "I do love competence in a man." -- Katharine Weber
